quickSummary.occupation: Founder, CEO, or senior tech role
quickSummary.location: Urban - Stockholm, Austin, London, Amsterdam, SF, NYC
quickSummary.brainType: ADHD (diagnosed or 'I have all the symptoms')

demographics.familyStatus: Partner, maybe kids (0-2), often feels guilty about not being present
demographics.livingSituation: Nice apartment or house, has space for a home sauna (or dreams of it)
demographics.spendingPatterns: Impulsive buyer of gadgets and wellness gear. Owns many things that collect dust.

theParadox.external: Built a company, raised money, appears successful and put-together
theParadox.internal: Brain never stops. 47 browser tabs. Feels like a fraud in wellness despite owning every gadget. Can't meditate.

dailyLife.morning: Up at 6, immediately checks Slack. Promises to do morning routine, gets sucked into email instead.
dailyLife.workday: Back-to-back calls. Context-switching. Thrives on chaos but crashes by 4pm.
dailyLife.evening: Tries to be present with family but brain solves work problems. Opens laptop 'just to check one thing' at 9pm.
dailyLife.sleep: Terrible. Racing thoughts. Oura ring confirms what they already know.

informationSources.socialMedia: Twitter/X for work, scrolls Reddit late at night, Instagram occasionally

relationshipWithWellness.problem: Buys everything, sticks with nothing. The novelty wears off. Feels like a wellness failure.
relationshipWithWellness.secretShame: Has spent $15K+ on wellness stuff that mostly collects dust. Knows meditation 'works' but can't make it stick.

saunaJourney.currentState: Uses gym sauna occasionally. Knows it's 'good for them' but hasn't made it a habit.
saunaJourney.desire: Wants to build a sauna at the summer house / in the backyard. Has researched for 6 months but paralyzed by options.
saunaJourney.barrier: Analysis paralysis. Too many choices. Doesn't trust generic reviews. Wants someone to just tell them what to buy.
saunaJourney.hiddenNeed: Actually wants the permission to sit still, not just the health benefits.

primaryGoals: Find a wellness practice that actually sticks (unlike the 20 abandoned meditation attempts)
Build a home sauna setup they'll actually use
Feel less guilty about being unable to 'just meditate'
secondaryGoals: Impress friends with a beautiful sauna setup
Have something to talk about other than work
Model healthy habits for kids (even if struggling themselves)
goalsAndMotivations.whatSuccessLooksLike: 4x/week sauna habit that stuck. Finally found the thing that quiets their brain. Tells every founder friend about it.

currentChallenges.pain: Information overload - too many conflicting protocols and reviews
currentChallenges.emotion: Overwhelmed. Just wants someone to tell them what to do.

currentChallenges.pain: Can't make wellness habits stick - novelty wears off after 2 weeks
currentChallenges.emotion: Shame. 'Why can I build a company but not meditate?'

currentChallenges.pain: Analysis paralysis on sauna purchase - it's a big decision
Generic wellness content feels preachy and doesn't get their brain

failedAttempts: Meditation apps (Headspace, Calm, Sam Harris - tried them all)
Morning routines (can't do before checking phone)

triggers: Saw another founder's sauna setup on Twitter and felt sauna envy
Finally closing funding round - time to invest in self
researchProcess: 1. Impulsively researches for 3 hours after seeing trigger
2. Opens 47 tabs, saves 12 links, bookmarks 5 videos
3. Gets overwhelmed, closes everything, forgets for 2 weeks
5. Finally wants someone to just TELL them what to buy

Fear of buying wrong thing (expensive mistake)
Partner buy-in on aesthetics and space
Worry it will become another unused purchase
convincers: Recommendation from someone who gets their brain type
Clear, no-BS comparison from trusted source
Understanding that sauna works for ADHD brains specifically
Permission to also care about the gear (not just the 'spiritual' part)

communicationPreferences.toneThatResonates: Fellow traveler who gets it. Not preachy. Allowed to like gadgets. Self-aware about optimization addiction.
keyMessagesThatWork: The one wellness thing that stuck
You can't bring your phone into the heat

messagingPillars.howToCommunicate: Sauna works because you CAN'T bring your phone. Your ADHD brain needs forced constraints, not more willpower.
You're allowed to like gadgets. You're allowed to fail at meditation. You're allowed to need help sitting still.
We do both. Beautiful equipment AND deeper meaning. No need to choose.
We'll tell you exactly what to buy. No more 47 open tabs.

redFlagsToAvoid: Dense walls of text (instant bounces from ADHD readers)
Guilt about buying gear or wanting nice things
Generic wellness content that doesn't acknowledge our specific audience
